8.6.17  4:41 pm   let me amend what i was worried about with the whole individuals thing. to be an individual i think is SUPER IMPORTANT AND MEANINGFUL!!!! but most of life's positions and jobs and stations are devoid of any respect for individuality. people are treated as assets, machines. i think most people just loan out their time in life as Unique people in order to have money, for living. that's AWFUL. i want to do so much, i dont want to be a machine. but am i really so different from most people? why do i deserve to escape the fate most are consigned to

8.6.17  3:10 pm   So I recently moved to a state where ive noticed that most people say "what's good" as a greeting. Where I'm from originally , most people say "what's up" instead. 'What's up' is easy to answer cause you can just say "not much" or say what your up to. But when people ask me "what's good" I feel like I shouldn't say "not much" or "nothing" cause that seems like it would be very depressing. "What's good?"... "Not much"....that makes me seem sad. Are you familiar with the "what's good" greeting? How would you normally respond? Am I supposed to just think of any random thing that I think is good?
8.6.17  2:03 pm   what are your thoughts on bass guitar as an instrument, what it should contribute to a song etc

8.6.17  1:17 pm   Do you ever have a very specific idea of what you want (maybe like a specific graphic, visual effect, sound effect/tone, etc) but you don't know how to actually go about executing your idea? For reference, there's blogs and vlogs but I want to make condensed what I'll call "slogs" (sound blogs) where I record all the sounds around me (speaking, car sounds, music, radio, footsteps, cooking sounds, animal sounds, literally any sound that can be picked up by a mic) for 24 hours.. then I went to take that 24 hour recording, splice it into 10 second fragments (or maybe 5 seconds or 15 seconds, haven't decided) and layer all the spliced clips on top of eachother and play it all simultaneously so you have this cacophony of 24 hours worth of sounds smashed into 10 seconds... but I don't think recording softwares can handle that much audio files, and cpu or phone batteries don't last 24 hours.... I really want to do this, but I don't see how it can be done... . and it 's wildly frustrating for me.
8.6.17  12:04 pm   A lot of folks seem to think everything you do is couched in irony.  Is this true?  I always get the impression that your work is a lot more earnest that you get credit for.

8.6.17  11:33 am   Hi, so I REALLY wanna learn to play the drums. I play guitar and bass, so I'm already familiar with playing music and how rhythm works (all the note/rest values, ties, triplets, etc. I'm even comfortable playing syncopated lines, polyrhythms, different time signatures and all that stuff) But when I actually try to sit down at a set and play around, I sound awful.. Do you think its mostly about building up muscle memory, just getting used to the technique and feeling of the drums? Another roadblock is that I don't own a kit (I live in an old apartment building, with VERY thin walls), so I practice either by tapping my feet while tapping on stuff with my hands, or by "air drumming". I really only get to play on an actual kit once a week or so at most (when I go over to a friends house for band practice). Any tips or advice???

8.5.17  9:10 pm   If we could somehow quantify the act of being reasonable,

     would you want the unit to be called a Wurtz?

     I.e. if you're being completely unreasonable, you're operating at 0 Wurtz, but if you're super reasonable, that's maybe 6 Wurtz. I estimate you are at a level of about 7.9 Wurtz so I doubt we can go higher. Also it's logarithm like the Richter scale so every increment of 1 Wurtz is 10 times more reasonable than the last Wurtz (e.g. 5 Wurtz is 100 times more reasonable than 3 Wurtz)
